<font style="display:inline;">&nbsp;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:24.5pt;text-align:left;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;">On </font><font
style="display:inline;">August 3</font><font style="display:inline;">, 2016, 
Summit Materials, Inc. (the &#x201C;Company&#x201D;) issued a press release 
announcing its financial results for the quarter ended </font><font 
style="display:inline;">July</font><font style="display:inline;"> 2, 2016. A 
copy of the press release is furnished as Exhibit 99.1 to this Current Report on
Form 8-K and is incorporated herein by reference. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:24.5pt;text-align:left;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;">&nbsp;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:24.5pt;text-align:left;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;">The information being furnished 
pursuant to this Current Report on Form 8-K, including Exhibit 99.1, shall not 
be deemed to be &#x201C;filed&#x201D; for purposes of Section&nbsp;18 of the 
Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#x201C;Exchange Act&#x201D;), 
or otherwise subject to the liabilities of that section, nor shall it be deemed 
incorporated by reference into any registration statement or other document 
filed under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange Act, except 
as expressly set forth by specific reference in such filing. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;text-indent:24.5pt;text-align:left;text-
justify:inter-ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;">&nbsp;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;text-align:left;text-justify:inter-
ideograph;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;">

<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-
family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 14pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-
size:14pt;">Summit Materials Announces Second Quarter 2016 Results </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-
size:10pt;">Denver, Colorado (August 3, 2016) &#x2014; Summit Materials, 
Inc.</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> (NYSE: SUM, 
&#x201C;Summit&#x201D; or the &#x201C;Company&#x201D;), a leading vertically 
integrated construction materials company, </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">announces</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> results for the second 
quarter</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> of</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> 2016. The Company has posted 
supplementary materials to its investor relations website. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:18pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-
size:10pt;">Highlights &#x2013; Second Quarter 2016 Compared to Second Quarter 
2015: </font>
</p>

0pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-

respectively; organic price up 6.7% </font></p></td></tr></table></div>

$0.4</font><font style="display:inline;font-

</font></p></td></tr></table></div>

%</font></p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="width:100%"><table style="width:100%;" cellpadding="0"
cellspacing="0"><tr><td style="width:18pt;"><p style="width:18pt;font-

display: inline;">

</td><td style="width:1pt;"><p style="width:1pt;width:1pt;font-

#D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;margin:4pt 0pt 
0pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">In
April 2016, entered the Las Vegas, Nevada market through the acquisition of a 
vertically integrated aggregates and ready-mixed concrete business, providing 
Summit with premier, well-located assets in an expanding 
market</font></p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="width:100%"><table style="width:100%;" cellpadding="0"
cellspacing="0"><tr><td style="width:18pt;"><p style="width:18pt;font-

display: inline;">
<p style="border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none

<font style="margin:4pt 0pt 0pt;font-
family:Symbol;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9;font-
size:10pt;;"> &#xB7;</font>
</p>
</td><td style="width:1pt;"><p style="width:1pt;width:1pt;font-
size:0pt;"></p></td><td align="left" valign="top">
<p style="border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none 
#D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;margin:4pt 0pt 
0pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">In 
May 2016, acquired seven aggregates quarries in central and northwest Missouri 
adding over 100 million tons of permitted reserves, primarily serving 
infrastructure and nonresidential demand&nbsp; 
</font></p></td></tr></table></div>
<div style="width:100%"><table style="width:100%;" cellpadding="0"
cellspacing="0"><tr><td style="width:18pt;"><p style="width:18pt;font-
size:0pt;"></p></td><td valign="top" align="left" style="width: 17.00pt; 
display: inline;">
<p style="border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none 
#D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;margin:4pt 0pt 
0pt;">
family:Symbol;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9;font-
size:10pt;;"> &#xB7;</font>
<font style="margin:4pt 0pt 0pt;font-
</p>
size:0pt;"></p></td><td align="left" valign="top">
</td><td style="width:1pt;"><p style="width:1pt;width:1pt;font-
<p style="border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none 
#D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;margin:4pt 0pt 
0pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;color:#000000;">Full year 2016 Adjusted EBITDA outlook upwardly 
revised to a range of $360.0 million&nbsp;&nbsp;to $370.0 
million</font></p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Tom Hill, CEO of
Summit, stated, &#x201C;We&#x2019;ve made considerable progress over the past 
year integrating acquisitions, which contributed significantly to our net 
revenue and Adjusted EBITDA</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> 
growth in the second quarter of 2016</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">. Our materials-based growth strategy was evident with higher 
aggregates and cement exposure benefitting our overall gross margin performance.
In cement, the</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> 
successful</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> integration of 
Davenport helped more than double Cement segment </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Adjusted </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">EBITDA</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">. &nbsp;</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">The positive cement</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> market</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> fundamentals in the Mississippi river 
region resulted in both volume and price improvements. </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">The Boxley, AMC and Sierra acquisitions 
completed during the </font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">year 
have all exceeded expectatio</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">ns and expanded our geographic</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> footprint into several high growth 
markets.</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> In our legacy 
businesses, we were pleased to achieve another quarter of organic price growth 
across all lines of business, including aggregates up 6.7%, helped by our 
effective price optimization focus. </font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">We experienced strong activity in North Texas highway demand and 
overall improvement in Utah, Kansas and Missouri. That said, o</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">rganic volumes were softer 
overall</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> due to wet weather, 
especially in Texas, lower aggregates volume in Vancouver with the completion of
a large sand river project in 2015 and some competitive pressure in Austin, 
Texas.</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">We expect </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">all three of </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">the</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">se factors to improve in the </font><font
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">second half</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> of the year</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> as we make additional</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">progress to grow our company. 
</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">M</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">ov</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">ing</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> forward in 2016, we are firmly situated 
to achieve our Adjusted EBITDA goals for the full year.&#x201D;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Brian Harris, CFO
of Summit, said, &#x201C;We ended the second quarter with </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">net </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">leverage </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">of 4.5x</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> primarily reflecting the 46</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">.</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">8</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">% increase in 
Adjusted EBITDA year-over-year. We were pleased to achieve this while funding 
two bolt-on transactions during the quarter and surpassing our targeted $30 
million of annualized acquired Adjusted EBITDA. Our capital investments in our 
announced aggregates facility enhancement initiatives are also moving forward on
schedule </font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;"></font></p></div><div style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-
right:10.2941176470588%;">
<p><font size="1"> </font></p><div style="width:100%">
New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;">
<p style="margin:24pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">1</font><font
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;"></font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font>
</p>
</div></div><div style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-
right:10.2941176470588%;"><hr align="center" style='background-color:#000000; 
border-width:0; color:#000000; height:2pt; lineheight:0; width:100%;'></hr><p 
style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p></div><div style="margin-
left:10.2941176470588%;margin-right:10.2941176470588%;"></div><div 
style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-right:10.2941176470588%;"><p 
style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none 
#D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;"><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">and on budget. With the continuation of 
strong results from our materials based-strategy along with ample liquidity on 
our balance sheet, we </font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">have 
the</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> flexib</font><font
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">ility</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> to pursue our strategy of acquiring 
attractively positioned reserves in </font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">attractive</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> 
markets with selective downstream exposure, while maintaining our commitment to 
reduce our leverage ratios by year end.&#x201D; </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:18pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
size:10pt;">Second Quarter 2016 Operating Results </font>
<font style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">In the second
quarter o</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">f 2016, net revenue
increased 25</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">.</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">4% to $412</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">.</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">6</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> million, 
compared to $329.0 million in the prior year quarter. The improvement in net 
revenue was primarily attributable to an increase in volumes across all lines of
business and higher prices in aggregates, cement and asphalt. Net revenue growth
from acquisitions in the West and East segments was $56.5 million compared to 
the prior year quarter. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Adjusted EBITDA
grew 46</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">.</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">8% to $114</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">.</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">7</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> million, 
compared to $78.1 million in the prior year quarter, with growth in all 
operating segments. As a percentage of net revenue, </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Adjusted EBITDA improved to 27.8%, up 
40</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">0 basis points from the 
prior year quarter. Adjusted EBITDA by segment in the second quarter of 2016 
compared to the prior year quarter was as follows: </font>
</p>

<font style="display:inline;font-

primarily driven by organic price growth in all lines of business and the impact

$37.6</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;"> 
million</font><font style="display:inline;font-

to the favorable impact of the Davenport cement plant acquisition and stronger 
end market demand. </font></p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-

10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Gross profit
increased 38</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">.</font><font

percentage of net revenu</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">e, 
gross margin improved to 38.8</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">%, compared to 35.2% in the prior year quarter, primarily 
attributable to a higher percentage of revenue from </font><font

style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">cost</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> saving initiatives</font><font
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">. &nbsp;</font>
</p>

re</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">venue from 
products increased 14</font><font style="display:inline;font-

primarily resulting from acquisitions. Ready-mixed concrete organic price 
increased 1.2%, largely benefitting from the pass through of higher cement 
prices. Asphalt price rose 1.7%, mainly due to a shift in geographic mix. Gross 
ma</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">rgin from 
products expanded to 26.9</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;color:#000000;">%</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;color:#000000;"> compared to 25.9% in the prior year quarter. 
</font></p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">In the second 
quarter </font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">of </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">2016, net income attributable to Summit 
Materials, Inc. was $</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">13.4 
million, and </font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">b</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">asic EPS was $0.22</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> per share of Class&nbsp;A common stock. 
The shares of Class&nbsp;A common stock are issued by Summit Materials, Inc., 
and as such the earnings and equity interests of noncontr</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">olling interests, including LP 
u</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">nits, are not included in 
basic earnings per share. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Adjusted net
income was $4</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">6</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">.2 mi</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">llion and Adjusted EPS was 
$0.46</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> per diluted share. 
Summit believes adjusted net income and Adjusted EPS are more representative of 
earnings performance, because these measures exclude the non-operating impact to
earnings per share of any potential conversions of LP units to Class A common 
stock in any given quarter.&nbsp; </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:9pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-
size:10pt;"></font></p></div><div style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-
right:10.2941176470588%;">
<p><font size="1"> </font></p><div style="width:100%">
New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;">
<p style="margin:24pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">2</font><font
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;"></font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font>
</p>
</div></div><div style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-
right:10.2941176470588%;"><hr align="center" style='background-color:#000000; 
border-width:0; color:#000000; height:2pt; lineheight:0; width:100%;'></hr><p 
style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p></div><div style="margin-
left:10.2941176470588%;margin-right:10.2941176470588%;"></div><div 
style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-right:10.2941176470588%;"><p 
style="margin:9pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none 
#D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;"><font 
style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">Acquisitions</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:4pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">In </font><font
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">April</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> 2016, Summit acquired Sierra</font><font
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> Ready Mix</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">, (&#x201C;Sierra&#x201D;)</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">, a vertically integrated aggregates and 
ready-mixed concrete business located in Las Vegas, Nevada.&nbsp;&nbsp;Sierra is
a well-established aggregates and ready mix concrete supplier in the Las Vegas 
market with an excellent reputation for quality and service.</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> Sierra</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> operates a sand &amp; gravel pit and two
ready-mixed concrete facilities and has well-balanced exposure across all end-
use segments. The acquisition provides Summit with premier, well-located assets 
in an expanding market. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:4pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">In May 2016,
Summit acquired seven aggregates quarries in central and northwest Missouri from
Oldcastle Materials. These quarries added over 100 million tons of permitted 
reserves, primarily serving infrastructure and nonresidential demand, which 
enhances the scale and aggregate reserves position of Summit&#x2019;s existing 
presence in Missouri.</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-
size:10pt;">Liquidity and Capital Resources </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:4pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size:
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">At July 2, 2016,
the Company had cash of $9.2 million</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">,</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> total 
outstanding debt of $1,537.2 million</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;"> and a </font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">borrowing
capacity </font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">of </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">$195.4 million</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">. Our borrowing capacity is</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> net of $25.6 million outstanding letters
of credit</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> and </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">$14.0 million of outstanding borrowings 
under the revolving credit facility.</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-
family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;">
conduct a conference call at 11:00 a.m. Eastern Time (9:00 a.m. Mountain Time)
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Summit will
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-
size:10pt;">Full Year 2016 Outlook </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">For the full year
2016, based on current market conditions</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">,</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> Summit expects
to generate Adjusted EBITDA in the range </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">of $3</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">6</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">0</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">.0 million to 
$370.0 million, </font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">compared to 
Adjusted EBITDA </font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">of 
$287.5</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> million in 2015. The 
Adjusted EBITDA outlook assume</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">s organic improvement, along with the successor period for 
acquisitions completed through today&#x2019;s date. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-
family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Summit continues
to target approximately $30.0 million of annualized Adjusted EBITDA per year 
from acquisitions. The upwardly revised full</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> year 2016 Adjusted EBITDA outlook 
</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">range of $3</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">60</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">.0 million to $370.0 million </font><font
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">excludes the potential upside from any 
future acquisitions due to the unspecified closing dates of any future 
acquisitions, the timing of which will impact the magnitude of acquired Adjusted
EBITDA realized in 2016. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-
size: 10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-
size: 10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-
size:10pt;">Webcast and Conference Call Information </font>
on Wednesday, August 3, 2016 to review second quarter 2016 results, discuss 
recent events, and conduct a question-and-answer period. A webcast of the 
conference call and presentation slides to be referred to on the call will be 
available in the Investors section of Summit&#x2019;s website at 
investors.summit-materials.com. To listen to a live broadcast, go to the site at
least 15 minutes prior to the scheduled start time in order to register, 
download, and install any necessary audio software. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:9pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size:

</p>

<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New

&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-
size: 12pt;">
<font style="display:inline;">&nbsp;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-
family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-
size:10pt;"></font></p></div><div style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-
right:10.2941176470588%;">
<p><font size="1"> </font></p><div style="width:100%">
New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;">
<p style="margin:24pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">3</font><font
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;"></font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font>
</p>
</div></div><div style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-
right:10.2941176470588%;"><hr align="center" style='background-color:#000000; 
border-width:0; color:#000000; height:2pt; lineheight:0; width:100%;'></hr><p 
style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p></div><div style="margin-
left:10.2941176470588%;margin-right:10.2941176470588%;"></div><div 
style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-right:10.2941176470588%;"><p 
style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New
Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;"><font style="display:inline;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">About Summit Materials </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Summit Materials
is a leading vertically integrated materials-based company that supplies 
aggregates, cement, ready-mixed concrete and asphalt in the United States and 
British Columbia, Canada. Summit is a geographically diverse, materials-based 
business of scale that offers customers a single-source provider of construction
materials and related downstream products in the public infrastructure, 
residential and nonresidential, and end markets. Summit has a strong track 
record of successful acquisitions since its founding and continues to pursue 
growth opportunities in new and existing markets. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">For more
information about Summit Materials, please visit </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;">www.summit-
materials.com</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">. &nbsp;</font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
size:10pt;">Non-GAAP Financial Measures </font>
<font style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-
</p>
<p style="margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">The Securities
and Exchange Commission (&#x201C;SEC&#x201D;) regulates</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> the use of &#x201C;non-GAAP financial 
measures,&#x201D; such as adjusted net income, Adjusted EPS, Adjusted EBITDA, 
gross profit and free cash </font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">out</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">flow, which 
are derived on the basis of methodologies other than in accordance with U.S. 
generally accepted accounting principles (&#x201C;U.S. GAAP&#x201D;). We have 
provided these measures because, among other things, we believe that they 
provide investors with additional information to measure our performance, 
evaluate our ability to service our debt and evaluate certain flexibility under 
our restrictive covenants. Our adjusted net income, Adjusted EPS, Adjusted 
EBITDA, gross profit and free cash </font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;">out</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">flow, may 
vary from the use of such terms by others and should not be considered as 
alternatives to </font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">or more 
important than </font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">net income 
(loss), operating income (loss), revenue or any other performance measures 
derived in accordance with U.S. GAAP as measures of operating performance or to 
cash flows as measures of liquidity. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Adjusted EBITDA
and other non-GAAP measures have important limitations as analytical tools, and 
you should not consider them in isolation or as substitutes for analysis of our 
results as reported under U.S. GAAP. Some of the limitations of Adjusted EBITDA 
are that these measures do not reflect: (i)&nbsp;our cash expenditures or future
requirements for capital expenditures or contractual commitments; 
(ii)&nbsp;changes in, or cash requirements for, our working capital needs; 
(iii)&nbsp;interest expense or cash requirements necessary to service interest 
and principal payments on our debt;</font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;"> and</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> 
(iv)&nbsp;income tax payments we are required to make. Because of these 
limitations, we rely primarily on our U.S. GAAP results and use Adjusted EBITDA 
</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">and other non-GAAP measures 
</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">only supplementally. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Adjusted EBITDA,
gross profit, adjusted net income, Adjusted EPS and free cash </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">out</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">flow reflect an additional way of viewing
aspects of our business that, when viewed with our GAAP results and the 
accompanying reconciliations to U.S. GAAP financial measures included in the 
tables attached to this press release, may provide a more complete understanding
of factors and trends affecting our business. We strongly encourage investors to
review our consolidated financial statements in their entirety and not rely on 
any single financial measure. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-
family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">Reconciliations
of the non-GAAP measures used in this press release are included in the 
</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">attached </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">tables</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">, to the extent available without 
unreasonable effort. Because GAAP financial measures on a forward-looking basis 
are not accessible, and reconciling information is not available without 
unreasonable effort, we have not provided reconciliations for forward-looking 
non-GAAP measures.</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> For the 
same reasons, we ar</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">e unable 
to address the probable</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> 
significance of the unavailable information, which could be material to future 
results. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-
size: 10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-
family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-weight:bold;font-
size:10pt;"></font></p></div><div style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-
right:10.2941176470588%;">
<p><font size="1"> </font></p><div style="width:100%">
New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;">
<p style="margin:24pt 0pt 0pt;text-align:center;font-family:Times
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">4</font><font
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font><font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;"></font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"></font>
</p>
</div></div><div style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-
right:10.2941176470588%;"><hr align="center" style='background-color:#000000; 
border-width:0; color:#000000; height:2pt; lineheight:0; width:100%;'></hr><p 
style="page-break-after:always">&nbsp;</p></div><div style="margin-
left:10.2941176470588%;margin-right:10.2941176470588%;"></div><div 
style="margin-left:10.2941176470588%;margin-right:10.2941176470588%;"><p 
style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New
Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;"><font style="display:inline;font-
weight:bold;font-size:10pt;">Cautionary Statement Regarding Forward-Looking 
Statements </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:6pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">This press
release contains &#x201C;forward-looking statements&#x201D; within the meaning 
of the federal securities laws, which involve risks and uncertainties. Forward-
looking statements include all statements that do not relate solely to 
historical or current facts, and you can identify forward-looking statements 
because they contain words such as &#x201C;believes,&#x201D; 
&#x201C;expects,&#x201D; &#x201C;may,&#x201D; &#x201C;will,&#x201D; 
&#x201C;should,&#x201D; &#x201C;seeks,&#x201D; &#x201C;intends,&#x201D; 
&#x201C;trends,&#x201D; &#x201C;plans,&#x201D; &#x201C;estimates,&#x201D; 
&#x201C;projects&#x201D; or &#x201C;anticipates&#x201D; or similar expressions 
that concern our strategy, plans, expectations or intentions. Any and all 
statements made relating to</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> 
the expectations for our anticipated benefits from recent 
acquisitions,</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;"> the 
macroeconomic outlook for our markets, potential acquisition activity, our 
estimated and projected earnings, margins, costs, expenditures, cash flows, 
sales volumes and financial results are forward-looking statements. These 
forward-looking statements are subject to risks and uncertainties that may 
change at any time, and, therefore, our actual results may differ materially 
from those expected. We derive many of our forward-looking statements from our 
operating budgets and forecasts, which are based upon many detailed assumptions.
While we believe that our assumptions are reasonable, it is very difficult to 
predict the impact of known factors, and, of course, it is impossible to 
anticipate all factors that could affect our actual results. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:12pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">In light of the 
significant uncertainties inherent in the forward-looking statements included 
herein, the inclusion of such information should not be regarded as a 
representation by us or any other person that the results or conditions 
described in such statements or our objectives and plans will be achieved. 
Important factors could affect our results and could cause results to differ 
materially from those expressed in our forward-looking statements, including but
not limited to the factors discussed in the section entitled &#x201C;Risk 
Factors&#x201D; in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended 
January 2, 2016. Such factors may be updated from time to time in our periodic 
filings with the SEC, which are accessible on the SEC&#x2019;s website at 
www.sec.gov. </font>

<td valign="bottom" style="width:75.40%;border-top:1pt

<font style="display:inline;font-

<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">Net
revenue for the cement line of business excludes revenue associated with the 
processing of hazardous and non-hazardous waste, which is processed into fuel 
and used in the cement plants and is included in services net revenue.

are included in products net revenue. The cement segment gross profit includes 
the earnings from the waste processing operations, cement swaps and other 
products. </font></p></td></tr></table></div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 0pt 21.6pt;text-indent: -21.6pt;border-
top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 12pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">*</font><font
style="display:inline;">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">The Davenport Assets were immediately 
integrated with our existing cement operations such that it is impracticable to 
bifurcate the growth attributable to the Davenport Assets from organic 
growth.&nbsp; </font>
</p>

size: 10pt;">

Inc. to adjusted income (loss) per share for the three and six months ended July

27</font><font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">, 2015.</font><font

for the purpose of reconciling to adjusted net income (loss) per share.</font>

<div style="width:100%"><table style="width:100%;" cellpadding="0"
cellspacing="0"><tr><td style="width:0pt;"><p style="width:0pt;font-
size:0pt;"></p></td><td valign="top" align="left" style="width: 18.00pt; 
display: inline;">
<p style="border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none
#D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;margin:0pt;">
<font style="margin:0pt;font-size:10pt;border-top:1pt
none #D9D9D9;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9;font-family:Times New 
Roman,Times,serif;;"> (1)</font>
</p>
</td><td style="width:0pt;"><p style="width:0pt;width:0pt;font-
size:0pt;"></p></td><td align="left" valign="top">
<p style="border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none
#D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 10pt;margin:0pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-
size:10pt;color:#000000;">Gross margin is defined as gross profit as a 
percentage of net revenue. </font></p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin:9pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-
bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 
10pt;">
<font style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">The following
table reconciles net cash used for operating activities to free cash outflow for
the three and six months ended July 2, 2016 and </font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">June 27</font><font 
style="display:inline;font-size:10pt;">, 2015. </font>
</p>
<p style="margin:9pt 0pt 0pt;border-top:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;font-
family:Times New Roman,Times,serif;font-size: 12pt;">
<font style="display:inline;">&nbsp;</font>
</p>
<div style="width:100%;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0"
style="border-collapse:collapse;width: 100.00%;margin-left:0pt;">
<tr>
<td valign="bottom" style="width:44.50%;border-top:1pt
none #D9D9D9 ;border-left:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;border-bottom:1pt none #D9D9D9 
;border-right:1pt none #D9D9D9 ;height:1.00pt;padding:0pt;">
<p style="margin:0pt;font-family:Times New
